website_summaries.verdict: Excellent price point for a 2-in-1 laptop/tablet combination that has plenty of power.
pros: Includes a touchscreen display that measures 13.5 inches, allowing you to rotate the screen and use it as a tablet
Includes 8 GB of RAM for nice performance speed
Includes 256 GB of SSD storage for a fast performance level
cons: Build quality for the laptop is questionable

customer_reviews.title: Connectors in keyboard?
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months' use, I realized that this product has a critical design fault. It's a non-sense that the product has all the connectors and slot in keyboard area instead of monitor area. When the monitor is disconnected from keyboard, it loses connection to external memories causing the functioning very unstable. I believe SD momory slot and at least one C-type USB slot has to be located in monitor body.
customer_reviews.author: SM Cho

customer_reviews.title: Just what the Project Manager ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Replacing my Samsung Galaxy Note Pro Tablet. Wanted/Needed to use MS Project in the field. Detachable screen for "tablet mode" works perfect. Still developing my pen skills, but looks promising. Great display even in the Arizona sun! Fits in my Saddleback case just right. Meets all my needs as a PM at nuke site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For artist?
customer_reviews.text: You Can't go into tablet mode without charge the 2 batteries to over 10 percentage. Can get in the way for artist on the go needing to make a quick sketch or something. Also these thing don't have good reviews as for as glitches and problems with screen and graphics cards. You might get a good one. You might get a bad one. Keep in my that at 1500-3000 you shouldn't be having any problems what so ever.

customer_reviews.title: Surface book 2
customer_reviews.text: I never got to use the laptop. It kept shutting off whenever I will touch the screen or any key on the keyboard. Also, the operating system kept requesting the same update each time I install this update. I had to return it and is waiting for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Battery life of tablet is abysmal, but everything esle is great
customer_reviews.text: I love the detachable tablet/screen. So much better than the convertibles - far lighter. The company that I bought mine from shipped it without a pen, though a pen was supposed to come with it, so I had to buy a pen. The pen functionality is good, though. Screen is clear. I love the keyboard. Only the battery life on the tablet alone is far less than I had hoped. I get about 2 hours (new) of use without having to re-dock the screen to the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Eiler

customer_reviews.title: Good device
customer_reviews.text: All in all a good device. i just ha a small issue with clip over the charging place holding magnets behind it. That was removed when got delivery. But it's small so i kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Pratik Vaishnavi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect laptop/tablet all in one
customer_reviews.text: I have used a couple of laptops before and this is by far my favorite. I like that it can go into a tablet and that both pieces, the keyboard and the screen, and thick enough to be sturdy unlike other keyboards which are just rubber. I bought the pen separately and it is an amazing addition to the laptop; I’m thinking of saving up and buying the other addition. I absolutely love this laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Hope Hume

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a bad seller
customer_reviews.text: I like it but my product had a dead battery. I asked to seller and he offered me to partial refund for visiting a manufacturer service center. I took the offer and spent a half day fixing the product, but the seller are ignoring a partial refund so far.

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is sleek and attractive but the aluminum is cheap and will chip easily. All-in-all, the laptop is not worth the ridiculous price. If not for my interests, I would have purchased a Macbook

Warranty said I still have around 3-4 months left, so I suppose it’s not too old. I’ve only used it for almost a week, so can’t say for the durability yet :D

customer_reviews.title: Former Mac User
customer_reviews.text: Switched to the Surface Book 2 from a 6.5yo MacBook Air. Never thought I would go back to a PC, but this allows me to better interface with my employer’s equipment. Have no complaints at this point and don’t miss my Mac at all.

customer_reviews.text: The device I received in the mail had defective hinge. The slightest movement made the device spazz thinking it was detached and attached. Returned right away.

customer_reviews.title: Line appears across screen after return date
customer_reviews.text: The laptop seems great when you first get it, but soon after the return date a discoloration line popped up across screen.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Overall good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great display, battery charges fast but does fast as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracked screen is an issue, buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware. Due to the gap in the hinge area, there is undue amount of stress on the glass screen while opening/closing and carrying around this otherwise wonderful laptop. It truly is an otherwise great device. My screen started forming cracks within a month of purchase and I do abuse my devices in any way (quite the opposite). Microsoft will not cover this under warranty, even though there are many cases of this. And the cost of screen replacement is $500. I would have highly recommended this product and even was going to buy for my work, but no way can I take this risk. You will be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Constantly replacing chargers
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely not worth it for the sole fact that the charger dies every couple months. I have had to buy three new ones in the past year so be prepared to spend another couple hundred dollars every couple years to have this computer. Not to mention this makes them extremely unreliable, I am in finals week and my charger just died again what happens if I can’t find a store with a charger in stock and the one I ordered doesn’t come on time for me to get all my work done. Thanks a lot microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Instenes
